Title: Optimisation Specialist
Responsibilities: About GoBear We dont usually toot our own horn but seeing as you might work here soon we thought you might like to know GoBear is Asias first and only metasearch engine for financial products We spend our days trying to figure out how to make comparing insurance and banking products as awesome as possible Our happy place is where users dont even have to think twice  they can choose a financial product thats right for them and feel confident with their choice we know thats a nerdy happy place but we cant help what we love Were looking for people who break the mould whove got a hankering to do something completely different Obviously we want our bears to be smart and hardworking but more importantly we want people on our team who love technology who love their job and who arent afraid to fail while trying something completely crazy Oh and if you have a chuckle while reading WYSIWYGcompanykarma GSD and If you dont listen to your customers someone else will then youll fit right into the team If that all sounds up your alley then read on                                                                     Whos who in the zoo Youll be reporting into the Conversion Director and youll also get to hang out with the Marketing and Product teams in the GoBear Support Centre helping to improve the Marketing spend ROI What fun youll get to have at GoBear                    We need an experienced nononsense handson person who can do most or all of these                                                  Youll be responsible for all Conversion Rate Optimization activities across GoBears products You will research and devise innovative conversion approaches Youll get to work with the Technical and Data teams to ensure data quality and reliability Youll oversee the selection of tools and technologies to enable maximum performance You will be working closely with product designers and the UX team to continuously test and drive revenue
Requirements: Got Skills                                                                                            You have 3 years of experience in CRO Consumer Analytics or related roles You have experience in developing and managing AB and MVT tests You have a Bachelors degree in a related field You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills You are an expert in Google tools Google Analytics Google Optimize Google Tag Manager If you have basic coding skills in Javascript JQuery HTML and CSS it will be a plus A Google Analytics Certification is a definite bonus  Does this sound like you  Youre a straight talker who gets stuff done and you dont break a sweat under pressure Youve got an eye for detail  you are meticulous and nothing slips by you Your friends and family probably get annoyed with you because you cant let a problem go unsolved You play well with others Youre great at prioritising your work and you never miss a deadline   A selfstarter who is highly motivated You love what you do and you always give 100  Need more reasons to come and work for us Youll get to learn from a multicultural team of fintech disruptors at one of the fastest growing online brands in Asia Our work makes us innovative agile brave and resultdriven but we also just love what we do  and because we love what we do were fun to be around well we think so anyway Weve got an open and transparent culture so what you see is what you get were not cool with office politics We value freedom and high performance above blindly following processes In fact we like it when you challenge our processes We also like it when you show curiosity for new ideas that make a difference And we love it when you discover practical solutions to tough problems We give lots of high fives for solving tough problems You can leave your car at home because weve got a neat office in the CBD just a short walk from Raffles Place MRT

Title: Data Center Facilities Manager - Singapore
Responsibilities: Company overview Google is not a conventional company and we dont intend to become one True we share attributes with the worlds most successful organizations  a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind  but even as we continue to grow were committed to retaining a smallcompany feel At Google we know that every employee has something important to say and that every employee is integral to our success We provide individuallytailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary bonus and equity components along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards Googlers thrive in small focused teams and highenergy environments believe in the ability of technology to change the world and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work For more information visit wwwgooglecomcareers The area Engineering  Operations Google is and always will be an engineering company We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technologys greatest challenges and make an impact on millions if not billions of users At Google engineers not only revolutionize search they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions largescale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world From Google Ads to Chrome Android to YouTube Social to Local Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another The role Data Center Facilities Manager  Singapore The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world Facility Technicians at Google data centers operate monitor and support physical facilities conditions Some duties will include heating and cooling of air and water power supply generators UPS systems electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems You regularly help inspect maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and noncritical electrical or mechanical system components Youll provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprintsschematics conduct tours of systems and assess their working order You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures Additional Role Description As a Data Center Facilities Manager you will lead a large team who are responsible for 247 data center operations You will be responsible for meeting service level agreements with internal teams regarding uptime efficiencies and cost In addition you will work to grow the team in order to meet the needs of the business while also leveraging technical talent and identifying key hiring needs for regional data centers Responsibilities  Provide technical input in the planning design and development of all electrical and mechanical facilities equipment  Ensure that facilities issues are identified and repaired quickly  Mentor and develop the skills of an internal team in order to scale in support of facilities equipment  Work towards continual improvement in operation and maintenance efficiencies and travel to other regions to facilitate projects  Lead a team of skilled electrical and mechanical technicians
Requirements: Minimum qualifications  Bachelors degree in MechanicalMarineElectrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience  6 years of experience in the management of teams performing installation maintenance or upgrade work in data center or businesscritical facilities Preferred qualifications  6 years of relevant work experience including experience in planning creating and implementing complex control system designs for large data center installations including overseeing negotiations or technical interactions with equipment providers  Experience as a Chief Engineer or Facilities Manager of Critical FacilitiesData Centers  Experience in electrical and mechanical systems and cooling principles Specialized experience with generators power electronics chillers and pumps  Experience in motivating leading and creating an effective team environment
Address: Marina Bay Financial Centre 8 Marina Boulevard 018981

Title: Research Associate
Responsibilities: A Research Associate position is available in the School of Electrical  Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University Established in 1981 the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING EEE httpwwweeentuedusg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University Built on a culture of excellence the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4000 of which about 1000 are graduate students it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical  Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects Job Description Recent studies have found that deep models can be easily fooled by adversarial examples which poses a big challenge for those safetycritical applications like autonomous vehicles The position is open for those who are interested in deep learning and computer vision The successful candidate should be familiar with object detection or semantic segmentation algorithm which will be used as our attack and defensive objective Then the candidate will be responsible for further research in the adversarial machine learning field to realize the attack and perturbation resistant techniques The successful candidate is expected to contribute in the research comprises the following topics 1 Enhance the attacks on opensource object detection model 2 Evaluate and enhance defenses against adversarial examples 3 Develop robustness evaluation and fooling recovery solutions on deep learning systems Apart from working on technical aspects of research projects the Research Associate will also take charge of general matters for the project including data management and project documentation writing project updates and doing product demonstrations and presentations

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical  Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University Established in 1981 the School of Electrical  Electronic Engineering EEE is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University Built on a culture of excellence the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research To support teaching and cuttingedge research EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories which are wellequipped with modern facilities and stateoftheart equipment With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4000 of which about 1300 are graduate students it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world The research staff will work on using machine learning approaches to tackle challenges in wireless communications such as blind signals classification and detection and channel parameter estimation in constrained channels etc Responsibilities  Developing machine learning algorithm to solve problems in wireless communications especially for blind receiver Testing the developed algorithms by using raw data Presenting work progress and publishing research findings Work closely with PI team members and collaborators to ensure timely and efficient completion of project milestones
Requirements: Education background experience required  PhD degree in Computer EngineeringComputer ScienceElectrical Engineering  Specific Knowledge  Skills  Strong foundation in wireless communication algorithms and optimization techniques Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning techniques and algorithms and opensource machine learning frameworks such as Keras and Tensorflow etc Familiarity with CPythonMatlab language Good English reading and writing skills Good communication skills and ability to work in a team  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: We have a oneyear Research Fellow position for the research work of microwave imaging using machine learning and holographic phase encryption   Expect to develop algorithms for microwave imaging and apply machine learning to improve their performance   Expect to combine wave physics with machine learning rather than a blackbox way of applying machine learning   Expected to develop robust phase retrieval algorithms and apply them to holographic phase encryption   Expected to study the sensitivity and complexity of security keys for the designed nanoscale security infrastructures
Requirements: Possess a PhD degree in electronic information science and technology or related fields specializing in electromagnetics or acoustics   Experienced in computational electromagnetics and inverse scattering problems Proficient in microwave imaging techniques and signal processing techniques   Experienced in numerical methods of electromagnetic scattering theory including method of moment discrete dipole approximation finiteelement method and boundary element method   Having experience in basic machine learning   Working experience of at least one year   Extensive use of electromagnetic simulation software such as GPRMAX   Open to fixed term contract

Responsibilities: At AI Singapore AISG we have a mission to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence AI and create social and economic impact accelerate the adoption of AI by Singaporebased organisations nurture the local talent and put Singapore onto the world map   As an AI Infrastructure Engineer under the AI Innovation Industry team youll help to build and operate modern infrastructures and systems to run machine learning and deep learning workloads at scale You are a person who strives to improve their knowledge of infrastructure systems and automation continually   Entrylevel graduates are welcome to apply for a Junior position for this role provided that they show some experience contributing in an infrastructurerelated Open Source project for at least a year or similar   Those with technical leadership experience are welcome to apply for a Senior position for this role   In this role you will  Build and maintain production infrastructure to be resilient secure and high performance Build and maintain infrastructure as code to automate the configuration provisioning deployment and monitoring of our systems Collaborate with AISG partners to design implement and deploy new systems and improvements to existing systems Work on infrastructure systems procurement and commissioning Document and investigate issues arising from our systems when they occur Develop tools and software that improves and automates infrastructure Propose and drive technical decisions to completion Mentor AISG Apprentices and others from a software engineering or infrastructure capacity

decision making mechanical elements like sensors and actuators electronic components for connecting and controlling the mechanical elements and software for higherlevel planning and process control Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical  Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University Established in 1981 the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING EEE is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University Built on a culture of excellence the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research To support teaching and cuttingedge research EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories which are wellequipped with modern facilities and stateoftheart equipment With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4000 of which about 1300 are graduate students it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world Job Description To treat neurological patients an indepth analysis and understanding of patientspecific EEG is required and critical However visual inspection of EEG recordings is prohibitively timeconsuming and most hospitals do not have the personnel for this task Automated algorithms to inspect EEG will allow us to analyse much larger volumes of EEG signals in turn allowing us to build up a detailed database of waveforms associated with epilepsy and other neurological disorders It has potential application in realtime seizure detection nonexpert EEG evaluation and improved understanding of neurological disorders We will develop deep learning methods for analysing EEG signals which is an entirely new approach with much potential Deep learning methods have consistently outperformed standard methods for speech and image analysis and are expected to outshine existing methodologies also for biomedical signals and EEG in particular In this project we have the following aims Aim1 To apply existing deep learning algorithms CNN and LSTM recurrent networks for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series and identify strengths and weaknesses of the existing algorithms Aim2 To develop novel deep learning algorithms based on Bayesian variational inference and other approaches for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series Aim3  To apply these deep learning algorithms for reliable EEGbased BCI classification and automatic detection of epileptic seizures from pediatric EEG Physionet dataset The Research Fellow will assist in conducting this research writing journal publications and preparing grant applications
Requirements: PhD degree in electrical engineering computer science or statistics Minimum 2 years of relevant experience Required skills include signal processing machine learning EEG analysis programming in Matlab Python C or C  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Title: Data Governance Officer
Responsibilities: COMPANY DESCRIPTION NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare childcare daily essentials cooked food and financial services Serving over two million customers NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives RESPONSIBILITIES The rapid adoption of technology and mobile devices have contributed to vast new flows of information which are larger in volume faster in velocity diverse in variety and requires veracity of the information for use This new type of information composed of structured and unstructured data broadly known as big data and combined with tools and platforms if utilised well could radically improve business performance Data Governance Officer  Heshe will manage all data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and managing the protection of sensitive data and information assets respond to regulatory protection requirements The position will focus on establishing an enterprise data governance framework for data policies standards and practices Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards data protection standards and adoption requirements across the enterprise Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies standards roles and responsibilities and adoption requirements Responsibilities  Design build and implement the organisation data governance framework Create and maintain data governance and or data management reporting Prepare maintain and present data quality reports Formulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy accuracy and legitimacy of data Ensure processes and controls are in place Roll out the relevant data governance framework and policies to various departments which include obtaining buyins from relevant stakeholders to embed operational processes to support the policy objectives Perform regular review of the data governance framework and policies to ensure they areupdated to meet changing organisational needs Contribute in terms of best practices and thought leadership in Data Governance  Strategy and in executing enterprisewide data governance tasks Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the toolsmethods that support data standards for the organization Assist with data monitoring and provide organizational management with guidance on streamlining data management
Requirements: Relevant years experience in enterprise data governance and management Experience in data analysis including inspection cleansing understanding and transforming data Experience in operationalising Data Governance Data Stewardship and Data Quality including good understanding of good management practices and data risk and regulatory issues Well organised and disciplined in maintaining documentation Familiar in working with SQL databases data structures and data modelling concept Strong interpersonal and people leadership skills to interact with diverse stakeholders  Preferred technical skills  Data architecture and data modeling Data Warehouse design ETLELT implementation and data integration

Company: Singapore-Mit Alliance For Research And Technology Centre
Title: Postdoctoral Associate / Research Scientist - Behavioral Modeling (Ref: Irg_Fm_2019_007)
Responsibilities: Project Overview Part of the FM research agenda involves the development of the SimMobility platform for the microsimulation of land use and transportation interactions   SimMobility is an agentbased simulator that links together various mobilitysensitive behavioral models with stateoftheart simulators to predict impacts of mobility demands infrastructure changes and evolving transportation options on the deployment and delivery of people firms services and freight  This particular Postdoctoral Associate will focus on the socalled longterm module of SimMobility The behavioral models in the longterm agentbased simulator address household residential choice vehicle availability firm location and realestate markets in a manner that is tightly integrated with an activitybased midterm model that estimates agentspecific logsum accessibility measures for simulated daily activity patterns The overall scope of FM research includes a number of projects on the development and analysis of new and advanced forms of mobility options such as ondemand mobility and autonomous vehicles as well as on their urban planning and management implications  Both FM and the SMART Centre encourage exploration of new ideas and the use of big data to advance our understanding of behavioral choices urban activity patterns and the adoption of new forms of mobility Responsibilities Depending upon project assignment and postdoc skills and interests the specific responsibilities will involve some combination of the following  Enhancing estimating and calibrating the behavioral models in the longterm simulator Generating and updating synthetic populations of residents firms and workers for particular cities at various points in time Performing complex data analysis and integration of geospatial datasets Contributing to the design and initiation of new research projects and ideas related to household and firm behavior as new options evolve for urban mobility and freight delivery Presenting research results at international workshops conferences and exhibits as well as at internal project meetings Coauthoring articles for publication in toptier peerreviewed journals and conferences and Monitoring the progress of project components supervising PhD students and regularly meeting with Principle Investigators
Requirements: The successful candidate must hold a doctoral degree in Urban Planning Transportation Engineering Econometrics or a related field Candidates with experience in urban modeling and data science will have an added advantage Additionally they should enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team environment that values problem solving skills and creativity  Advanced skill and experience in data processing and analysis is required Expertise in agentbased modeling urbanscale transport modeling andor behavioral economics and realestate markets is desired Knowledge of urban economics discrete choice models geoprocessing and database management is expected Experience with programming in scientific languages eg Python and R is necessary Familiarity with objectoriented programming languages eg C and Java is desired Independent thinking and innovative scientific accomplishments demonstrated via published papers is expected Outstanding oral and written communication skills in English is required  The Postdoctoral Associate will work with an integrated team of faculty researchers and students from MIT and Singapore University partners including among others Professors Joseph Ferreira Christopher Zegras and Moshe BenAkiva of MIT Interested applicants should submit the following  A motivation letter one or two pages stating the applicants interest in working with the Lab research areas andor projects of particular relevance key competencies and anticipated date of availability A full CV including degrees relevant projects and positions with dates and key relevant publications up to 5 and Names and contact information of three references    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Title: Research Fellow (Bioinformatician, Sign)
Responsibilities: A Bioinformatician research fellow postdoctoral position is available in Dr Jinmiao Chens SingleCell Computational Immunology SCCI lab The position will perform singlecell RNAseq data analysis and derive knowledge from the data by applying stateoftheart tools or developing novel computational methods The analytical scope may include data preprocessing quality control to remove low quality cells normalizationbatch effect correction dimensionality reduction clustering analysis automatic cell type identification cell lineage and pseuedotime inference celltocell interactions integration of heterogeneous datasets and data types building human singlecell atlas and etc The work will involve a wide range of exciting and cuttingedge research projects including human cancer immunology ex Leukemia Gasstric Cancer Lung Cancer etc infectious diseases ex TB Dengue HIV HBV etc autoimmune diseases ex SLE psoriasis atopic dermatitis etc and fundamental research to understand immune system ex heterogeneity origins and functions of dendritic cells macrophages T cells B cells and etc Where existing computational methods are not adequate to handle the data the candidate will have the opportunity to develop novel methods under the PIs supervision and with help from other lab members The lab is currently focusing on developing SingleCell Big Data  Artificial Intelligence framework and several AI analytical tools under development are to be released in near future The candidate will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative environment interact with excellent scientists from multiple disciplines and grow rapidly in both biological and computational knowledge and skills The position will have the opportunity to publish firstauthored and coauthored papers in highimpact journals and international conferences as well as patent publication and potential commercialization of the tools to be developed In addition the candidate will have the opportunity to work with MNC pharmaceutical companies via industrial collaborations  Singlecell analysis of crosstalk between tumor immune cells and pathogens in gastric cancer Mapping hematopoietic lineages of healthy and highrisk acute myeloid leukemia patients with FLT3ITD mutations using singlecell omics Develop computational methods for analysing singlecell data Collaborate with other labs and provide data analysis on various projects
Requirements: PhD in any of computational biology bioinformatics biostatistics computer scienceengineering mathematics or related fields Programming skills using any of Rpythonperlshell scriptCMatlabJava or similar Experience in analysis of NGS or singlecell RNAseq data preferred Machine learning and AI background optional Experience in data management database design and implementation an added advantage Selfmotivated and willing to learn Able to work under supervision and autonomouslyindependently Good team player with good interpersonal skills

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow
Responsibilities: Job Opportunity at National University of Singapore for Research Project on You Are What You Surf Characterizing Preference and Decisionmaking Styles with Digital Footprints  We are seeking an enthusiastic and capable fulltime Postdoctoral Fellow to assist the Principal Investigator Assistant Professor Rongjun Yu in the above research project which is funded by the Social Science Research Thematic grant SSRTG Primary responsibilities for the Postdoctoral Fellow involve data analyses and manuscript preparation for studies using neuroeconomics paradigms to investigate decision making in a big data sample  Writeup about the project In this project we will study how analysing big data in Singapore retrieved from socialmedia  FacebookTwitterInstagram users can be used to predict and generate meaningful inferences about both individual and societylevel decisionmaking styles We will assess the participants decision making styles by having them complete a battery of online behaviouraleconomic games designed to measure various aspects of decisionmaking The goal is to use big data to predict citizen characteristics such as decisionmaking style
Requirements: Qualifications The candidate should possess the following qualifications  A PhD in decision neuroscience psychology psychiatry or related field Prior experience with computational modelling is preferred The successful candidate also should have strong writing skills and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively Excellent written and spoken communication skills Strong organizational skill and interpersonal skill   The start date is flexible Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled The salary is highly competitive for strong candidates   Invitation to apply Interested applicants are invited to send the following list of documents to Centre for Family and Population Research via email psyyrnusedusg to Dr Rongjun Yu with the subject title Postdoctoral Fellow for project on You Are What You Surf Characterizing Preference and Decisionmaking Styles with Digital Footprints  PI Dr Rongjun YU    Cover letter and Resume outlining your interest qualifications expected salary and publications if any Research statement max of 3 pages Personal particulars form httpwwwfasnusedusgcfprjoinuspersonal_particulars_academic_staffdoc  NUS Personal Data Consent for Job Applicants httpwwwfasnusedusgcfprjoinusNUSPersonalDataConsentforJobApplicantspdf Copies of degree scrolls and transcript of grades  4 official letters of recommendation  	   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified via email
